title: Okwara
author: Okwara
content: A devastating earthquake of magnitude 6.8 hit central Morocco a few hours ago. According to the BBC news, at least 820 people have died while over 600 people are being hospitalized. A lot of damage was caused by the earthquake.According to the US Geological Survey, The epicenter was in the High Atlas Mountains, about 71km (44 miles) south-west of Marrakesh, at a depth of 18.5km. This is really a very hard time for the people of Morocco. They really need the support of every one of us and especially the international community.May the almighty God see them through.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Terrible news, I hope & pray many of the people lost or unaccounted for are found OK. For all those who have lost their lives, may they rest in peace & their loved ones recover eventually.Here is the link for anybody who wants more detail -https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-africa-66760889

comments.body: Seriously? The best shot your got at getting help is asking people to pray? I think it would be much more useful to ask for help and international support, but the best thing your could actually do for the people of Morocco is firstly get rid of your monarch, which seems to care too much for his German friend and gang and little for his "subjects" and then keep on getting rid of the kleptocracy and have a chance to become the great country it could be.

comments.body: Sorry for Moroccan people. US sources say 6.8 but Moroccan sources say 7.0. Either way it's not a small earthquake but number of death looks too many for this kind of earthquake. I heard it's the biggest earthquake in Morocco in the last century so they may have been caught unprepared. If there are many buildings that are not suitable for earthquakes especially in rural areas, this may have increased the number. There are many earthquakes in our country. Even though we are better prepared, we have many losses in these earthquakes. I can feel their pain. I hope everything gets better soon there.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: My personal condolences to the people in Morocco.Leaving the causalities and material damages on one side, I would like to comment on something I think it is curious.Here in my country ans in other countries in this continent we have had to deal with earthquakes of similar magnitude or strength before, the last one I recall was quite strong and I remember to see my house move much, however, there were no casualties or massive material damages here.Leads me to believe that perhaps Morocco infrastructure was not built keeping in mind such destructive events taking place?

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on September 10, 2023, 02:23:48 AMMy personal condolences to the people in Morocco.Leaving the causalities and material damages on one side, I would like to comment on something I think it is curious.Here in my country ans in other countries in this continent we have had to deal with earthquakes of similar magnitude or strength before, the last one I recall was quite strong and I remember to see my house move much, however, there were no casualties or massive material damages here.Leads me to believe that perhaps Morocco infrastructure was not built keeping in mind such destructive events taking place?The devastation will depend on the magnitude of the earthquake and the areas it happened. The earthquake in Morocco is a powerful 6.8-magnitude and it is the highest the country has ever experienced since 1900. Marrakech the worst-hit area is mountainous which makes it a complicated terrain to build on. But your point is valid Hispo, most of those houses were not built to withstand this kind of natural disaster. With the knowledge of how earthquake-prone the areas are, the structures there would have been built to withstand this disaster. All these irregularities and substandard building is caused mainly by poverty and corruption. Most of these local dwellers are poor and can not afford standard houses and the government has been accused of mismanaging the country's resources. This was the same problem Turkey had when 7.8 and 7.5 magnitude hit the country. Most of the buildings were not built based on modern technological standards and the latest earthquake regulations. Corruption was the main issue in Turkey because regulatory bodies failed to do their work. Lands were even allocated to estate companies to build in areas that shouldn't be built on. There has been help from countries like Qatar, Spain, UK, and Joe Biden just announced that the US will give Morrocco all the support they need. We just hope that they get all the support they need to overcome this great loss.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: The news shocked the entire world, including the African continent and closed European countries in the region. Natural catastrophes often have a long-term impact on the countries they affect, I hope they are able to overcome the loss and find an irreplaceable solution to this or reduce the likelihood of it happening again in the future. Natural catastrophes cannot be avoided, but their effects can be lessened by educating people about the hazards and teaching earthquake safety, which can help reduce human-caused earthquakes. This is heartbreaking news for the Moroccan people, and I hope the international community responds quickly. Many people have expressed their heartfelt condolences and prayers to them. I hope and pray they overcome this and we also pray such never happens to any country in the future again.

comments.author: sesterceshop
comments.body: My heart goes out to the people of Morocco during this incredibly difficult time. The magnitude of this tragedy is truly staggering. The location of the epicenter, in the High Atlas Mountains, adds to the challenges. It's crucial that we come together as a global community to offer support and assistance. Death toll is now at 2,122 people and 2,421 injured (1,400 critically). Let's keep them in our thoughts and prayers.

comments.author: Pingrapole
comments.body: This is very terrible news for us as human beings and very pitiful which pains our hearts As far as I know the death toll has gone above 2000.It is certain that their economic condition will be severely affected as the damage has already been done and we the people of the world should come together and share their sufferings with them.We should pray more for them even if we can't help them financially that they can successfully return to their former status.To my knowledge, Morocco has seen such a terrible earthquake in many years and the death toll may rise.It is difficult to say what the death toll will be in the end as the death toll is increasing every day and the reports of the outbreak are increasing one after the other.Finally, we need all countries to step up on their humanitarian side and step up fast otherwise the death toll from these accidents will continue to rise, and their economic condition will collapse.And they will fall behind in every way, so we should come forward especially with financial help if not military and other means personal help should come forward come back to.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Quote from: Okwara on September 09, 2023, 12:40:54 PMThis is really a very hard time for the people of Morocco. They really need the support of every one of us and especially the international community.May the almighty God see them through.The earthquake that occurred in one of Morocco's cities, Marrakech, that caused 2681 deaths and 2501 injuries is currently receiving the necessary support from the international communities. Days after the incident, some international communities intervened by sending aid to the Moroccan people to help in the rescue of those who are yet to be rescued and the delivery of urgent medical care to those who are most in need of it to survive. In response to the earthquake, the EU has donated one million euros for humanitarian purposes. The countries that have so far provided relief to the citizens of Marrakech are Italy, Turkey, Tunisia, Algeria, France, the United Kingdom, the United States, and Spain.To read further about the aid provided by each country click hereMy heartfelt condolences to the people of Morocco. Let Allah console the families that have lost their loved ones and bring special healing to those that need it most
